Bjorn (sorry, can't find the "o" with slash through it) already answered 
most of the C/C++ issues .. but basically:

Gladiator was programmed in a mixture of C++ and 80x86 Assembly, using the 
Watcom C++ compiler.  Basically, we used C++ for most of the code, 
especially object hierarchy, list management, AI routines, etc., and 
assembly for the fast graphics routines.  One of our members created a 
basics graphics engine in assembly, which the rest of us then used for the 
game.

For code sample .. I'd actually be happy to share some of it, if you have 
any specific questions (ie, certain types of routines, or whatever).  Just 
let me know.

As to helping out the FSGames team, there's not much you can do right now, 
I'm afraid -- two of the team are working for Blizzard, and so they're 
pretty much tied up 150% right now with Diablo 2.  I'm working full time at 
a "normal" job, and also working for the http://www.sluggy.com site, which 
also takes a fair amount of time, so .. unless you have a nifty time 
machine for us, or a way to squeeze more hours into a day, there's not much 
that'd help :)

Take care,
   Tom
